Question: What does this marking mean?

Drive on but increase your speed
Stop until the lights no longer flash

Question: What must you do at an intersection controlled by a Stop sign?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop
Stop only if you can do so safely
Continue driving unless you can see an oncoming vehicle

Question: When must you signal that you are turning to the right?

Answers.Answer: Only if there are vehicles in front of you
3 seconds or more before you turn
Only if there are vehicles following behind you

Answers.Answer: Sound the horn on your vehicle to move them out the way
Slow down or pull over to the side of the road
Turn on your vehicle hazard lights and drive on
Drive down the centre of the road

Question: What must you do if you want to turn right at traffic signals where a green light is showing?

Answers.Answer: Push your way through the vehicles coming towards you
Give way to vehicles coming towards you
Wait until the lights change to red and then turn quickly
Turn at once as the vehicles coming towards you will be stopped

You are driving on a country road at night when your vehicle headlights suddenly go out. What is the safest thing to do?

Answers.Answer: Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle hazard lights on
Slow down and drive on the far left side of the road
Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle’s interior lights on
Slow down, move off the road gradually, stop and turn your vehicle hazard lights on

Check your blind spot before moving left
Ensure that there are no oncoming vehicles

Question: When turning right from a two-laned road into a one-way street that has two lanes, which lane must you turn into?

Question: Which person can legally stop and do a roadside check of your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Keep as close as you can to the centre of the road
Keep as close as you can to the left side of the road

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?
